com.blockhaus2000.util

Class StringUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.blockhaus2000.util.StringUtil

  • public class StringUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a util class for Strings. You can use the static methods in this class for basic String operations that are not implemented in the Java SE, such as joinString or something else.
    Author:
    Blockhaus2000

    • Method Detail

      • joinString

        public static java.lang.String joinString(int i,
                          java.lang.String delimiter,
                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> list)
        Joins the give List to a String. The given delemiter will be placed between the entrys of the given List. The index is the index of the elemt of the given List, where the join algorithm has to start.
        Parameters:
        i - The "join-start" index. Cannot be smaller than 0 or bigger or equals the size of the given List.
        delimiter - The delmiter that has to be placed between the elements of the given List.
        list - The List that has to be joined to a String. If it is null or empty, This method returns an empty String.
        Returns:
        The joined String or, in the case that the given List is null or empty, an empty String.

      • joinString

        public static java.lang.String joinString(int i,
                          java.lang.String delimiter,
                          java.lang.String... array)
        Joins the given String[] (implemented with var args) to a String. Will call joinString(int, String, List).
        Parameters:
        i - The "join-start" index. Will be given to joinString(int, String, List).
        delimiter - The delimiter that has to be placed between the elements of the given List. Will be given to joinString(int, String, List).
        array - The String[] that has to be joined to a String . Will be given to joinString(int, String, List).
        Returns:
        The return of joinString(int, String, List).
        See Also:
        joinString(int, java.lang.String, java.util.List)

      • joinString

        public static java.lang.String joinString(java.lang.String delimiter,
                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> list)
        Joins the given List to a String. Will call joinString(int, String, List) with i = 0.
        Parameters:
        delimiter - The delimiter that has to be placed between the elements of the given List. Will be given to joinString(int, String, List).
        list - The List that has to be joined to a String . Will be given to joinString(int, String, List).
        Returns:
        The return of joinString(int, String, List).
        See Also:
        joinString(int, java.lang.String, java.util.List)

      • joinString

        public static java.lang.String joinString(java.lang.String delimiter,
                          java.lang.String... array)
        Joins the given String[] (implemented with var args) to a String. Will call joinString(int, String, List) with i = 0.
        Parameters:
        delimiter - The delimiter that has to be placed between the elements of the given List. Will be given to joinString(int, String, List).
        array - The String[] that has to be joined to a String . Will be given to joinString(int, String, List).
        Returns:
        The return of joinString(int, String, List).
        See Also:
        joinString(int, java.lang.String, java.util.List)

      • escape

        public static java.lang.String escape(java.lang.String str)
        This method will escape all chars of the given String. That means that "abcdfg" will be escaped to "\\a\\b\\c\\d\\e\\f\\g".
        Parameters:
        str - The String that has to be escaped.
        Returns:
        The escaped String.
